Edited March 8, 2020 by Sunnyk

I'd get the Module Manager in any case, it's a requirement for the majority of mods.

Now, let's try to get to the root of your problem. You say  

2 hours ago, Sunnyk said:

but nothing loads in game

I assume you followed the instructions on the first page of this thread, and checked the common issues and how to resolve those?  

On 1/11/2017 at 1:49 PM, sarbian said:

Common problems

  • The MechJeb menu is not showing. First make sure you have the part on your ship (AR202 case in the Control section). Some windows protection and anti-virus can sometimes block KSP from loading MechJeb. You should install KSP outside the C:\Program Files (x86) directory. Steam has an option to change the install directory of a game or you can just copy the directory somewhere else.
  • Some function are not present in career. Some function require to unlock some specific node in the Research and Development tree. Some other also require to upgrade the tracking station to level 2 (Game code restriction we can't do much about)

If that doesn't help, can you please provide log files as outlines in this thread?
I noticed it several times. that after the automatic maneuver, the periapsis was deep in the atmosphere or even below the surface of the planet. I would like to be able to control such situations.

MJ, as per my experience, tends to start burns a bit late (Jim DiGriz and sarbian would heavily disagree here, lol), hence the PE after a burn tends to be too low.

I learned to live with it, me being lazy, I prefer to do a little correction burn shorty after.

Hi I'm pretty new to the game(almost 30hrs.) and I found MJ mod but I have a question; Is there a more detailed version of the mod because this one here is kinda absent in some sub-titles.(Or detailed videos can do)

8 hours ago, chuckreis said:

Hi I'm pretty new to the game(almost 30hrs.) and I found MJ mod but I have a question; Is there a more detailed version of the mod because this one here is kinda absent in some sub-titles.(Or detailed videos can do) 

Perhaps you have a career mode and not all MJ modules are studied?

16 hours ago, VoidSquid said:

MJ, as per my experience, tends to start burns a bit late (Jim DiGriz and sarbian would heavily disagree here, lol), hence the PE after a burn tends to be too low.

I learned to live with it, me being lazy, I prefer to do a little correction burn shorty after.

It seems to me that the later ignition is due to a change in thrust during burning due to fuel consumption, and MJ takes this into account.

Edited March 10, 2020 by Craze
Change language

16 minutes ago, Craze said:

It seems to me that the later ignition is due to a change in thrust during burning due to fuel consumption, and MJ takes this into account.

I think so too, yes, but at least for me the fact remains that MJ tends to overburn slightly. I compared transfer burns done manually and via MJ, and the manual burns, when started at the correct moment (I follow KER here), often are less off in terms of final trajectory, than the MJ burns. I asked Jim DiGriz some time ago, and he told me MJ has a different method to calculate when to start a burn than stock or KER.

Edited March 10, 2020 by VoidSquid
I found the cause of the autopilot problems for the Rover. This was the Signal Delay mod.

Hmm... my KSP.log has these lines:

[LOG 18:12:35.687] AssemblyLoader: Loading assembly at D:\Kerbal Space Program 1.8\GameData\MechJeb2\Plugins\MechJeb2.dll
[LOG 18:12:35.776] AssemblyLoader: KSPAssembly 'MechJeb2' V2.5.0

No such lines in your log, but I see 

[WRN 21:01:55.241] AssemblyLoader: Assembly 'CC_RemoteTech' has not met dependency 'RemoteTech' V1.7.0
[WRN 21:01:55.241] AssemblyLoader: Assembly 'CC_RemoteTech' is missing 1 dependencies
[WRN 21:01:55.241] AssemblyLoader: Assembly 'KerKonConConExt' has not met dependency 'KerbalKonstructs' V0.9.0
[WRN 21:01:55.241] AssemblyLoader: Assembly 'KerKonConConExt' is missing 1 dependencies
[WRN 21:01:55.241] AssemblyLoader: Assembly 'TestFlightRF' has not met dependency 'TestFlightAPI' V1.5.0
[WRN 21:01:55.241] AssemblyLoader: Assembly 'TestFlightRF' has not met dependency 'TestFlight' V1.5.0
[WRN 21:01:55.241] AssemblyLoader: Assembly 'TestFlightRF' is missing 2 dependencies
[WRN 21:01:55.241] AssemblyLoader: Assembly 'SCANmechjeb' has not met dependency 'MechJeb2' V2.5.0
[WRN 21:01:55.241] AssemblyLoader: Assembly 'SCANmechjeb' is missing 1 dependencies

I looks like there are several inconsistencies in your GameData folder, in particular there seems to be no MechJeb at all, though I do see it listed under the section "Folders and files in GameData".

In the section "Mod  DLLs found" there is no line for MechJeb at all.

Questions then: does the content of your MJ folder look right? And are you sure than your MJ is compatible with your KSP version?

I'd also try to delete the MM cache files from the GameData folder (i.e. all MM files but the DLL), this way forcing MM to rescan everything the next time you start KSP, instead of relying on the cache.

41 minutes ago, lk00david said:

I'm gonna try to delete the cache when I get home, must've missed that the first time

Deleting the cache won't help. The DLL is not here so I am not sure of what you installed and how you installed it.

@lk00david I would look at your KIS/KAS install and it's dependencies.  They can't find the associated KSPDev_Utils dependency for each and are throwing reflection exceptions that I've seen create errors in unrelated mods. It may not be your issue with mechjeb, but I wouldn't trust a KSP install with any reflection exceptions during load to tell you what's really wrong.  I recommend ckan instead of manual installs as it's been bulletproof and simple for me to maintain mods with.
